name: Catherine Cathiard
goal: As an lawyer admitted to the Paris (France) and Luxembourg Bars, I am active in national company law and  European company law dealing with cross border reorganizations of companies. My clients are international groups, listed or unlisted companies, SMEs. I participated to the setting up of many European Companies (Societas Europaea, SE) in France and in Luxembourg. I work in cooperation with lawyers of many countries.
interests: Business and Industry, Culture, Economy, finance and the euro, Fraud prevention, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
• Chairman of the think-tank of PARIS EUROPLACE on the Societas Europaea (Paris, 2013).

• Expert in European company law for the Commission of Legal Affairs of the European Parliament

 Project leader, coordinator of the European team, responsible for the relationships with the European Parliament and expert in French and European company law for the European Added Value Assessment: “Directive on the cross-border transfer of a company’s registered office (14th Company Law Directive)”, European Added Value Unit of the Directorate for Impact Assessment and European Added Value, Directorate General for Internal Policies (DG IPOL) of the General Secretariat of the European Parliament, PE 494.460, EAVA 3/2012.

 Coordinator of the European team, responsible for the relationships with the European Parliament and expert in French and European company law for the study: “Relations between company supervisory bodies and the management”, European Parliament, Directorate General For Internal Policies, Policy Department C, Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs, PE 462.454, 2012.

 Coordinator of the European team, responsible for the relationships with the European Parliament and expert in French and European company law for the study: “Rights and obligations of shareholders – National regimes and proposed instruments at EU level for improving legal efficiency”, European Parliament, Directorate General For Internal Policies, Policy Department C, Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs, PE 462.463, 2012.

 Active as coordinator of the European team, relationships with the European Parliament and expert in French and European company law for the study “Relations between company supervisory bodies and the management”, European Parliament, Directorate General For Internal Policies, Policy Department C, Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs, PE 462.464, 2012.

• Former member of the think tank supporting Senators Jean-Guy Branger and Jean-Jacques Hyest, president of the Law Commission of the French Senate, which led to the draft bill dated January 19th 2004 "European Company (Societas Europaea)”: Implementation into French Law of EC Regulation n°2157/2001 and Directive n°2001/86/CE".
